meanings.definition: Compulsives (noun): People who have a strong urge to do something repeatedly.
meanings.sent1: The compulsives in the group always had to check the door twice before leaving.
meanings.sent2: She noticed the compulsives in her class always tapped their pencils on the desk.
meanings.sent3: The compulsives at the office made sure to organize their desks meticulously.
meanings.sent4: The compulsives in the kitchen were like busy bees, always buzzing around.
meanings.sent5: The compulsives' need for order was evident in their color-coded schedules.

meanings.definition: Compulsives (adjective): Describing someone who feels compelled to engage in certain behaviors.
meanings.sent1: The compulsives need to double-check everything can be exhausting for others.
meanings.sent2: Her compulsives behavior of always arriving early made her a reliable friend.
meanings.sent3: His compulsives need for cleanliness meant his room was always spotless.
meanings.sent4: The compulsives drive to succeed pushed her to work late into the night.
meanings.sent5: The compulsives attention to detail made him a valuable asset to the team.
